meanings.sent1: The unsmart student struggled with the math problem.
meanings.sent2: She felt unsmart when she couldn't solve the riddle.
meanings.sent3: It was unsmart of him to forget his keys inside the locked car.
meanings.sent4: Her unsmart decision to skip studying cost her a good grade.
meanings.sent5: The unsmart crow kept trying to pull the food out of the closed jar.

meanings.sent1: The unsmart explorer got lost in the forest.
meanings.sent2: He felt unsmart for not knowing the answer to the question.
meanings.sent3: It was unsmart of her to believe everything she read online.
meanings.sent4: His unsmart choice to trust a stranger led to trouble.
meanings.sent5: The unsmart decision to go out without a map left them stranded.

meanings.definition: Not quick or alert in perception or understanding.
meanings.sent1: The unsmart guard failed to notice the intruder.
meanings.sent2: She felt unsmart for missing the important detail.
meanings.sent3: It was unsmart of him to overlook the warning signs.
meanings.sent4: His unsmart reaction caused him to trip over the obstacle.
meanings.sent5: The unsmart driver didn't see the red light and almost caused an accident.
